content.description: Directly beside "Running Man" by only a couple inches find the big jug undercling and small left ripple to stand start at. Smear feet and stand up to rail horizontal pinch and then take it to the top.

A fun no-hands challenge and also the quickest way off of the boulder on the backside. To the far left side of the main long face look for the low, ascending ledges leading up toward the close tree. Hop up and work left up the face with no hands until you can walk up onto the top of the boulder.
content.location: Far left side of the left, long main face of the Shade Boulder

content.description: Stand start at arete with two very low underclings and a perched foot on the arete. Follow nice holds to the seam, then stand to the nice lip for an easy top out.

Just left of False Alarm, and about three feet to the right of the nice arete. Find the interesting large undercling/pocket feature very low to the ground and start there with good ramp feet.Work directly up to the long thin left facing crimp rail. Take it to the top.

Just left of the middle, close tree on the main long face, several feet left of "Bullseye". Stand start very low compressing two side-pull chunks with two (distant) big, low feet. Reach up to long flat ledge rail, then take it to the top out

At the uphill-most face, to the far right side. Stand start with a right hand undercling and a left hand low, flat rail. Use the big left foot chunk, and any smear for your right. Reach out to small rail up and right. Top out.
content.location: At the uphill-most face, to the far right side.

content.description: walk past the arete to the left side of the boulder. Stand start in between the tree and arete. Start holds are the high side-pull under the shelf and the rounded left hand rail. Climb up into undercling shelf and up the face to horizontal rail and top out above.

This is the lower start to Happy Days. One hold lower, twice as hard maybe? Walk past the arete to the left side of the boulder. Stand start in between the tree and arete. Start holds are Â the rounded left hand rail and the lower, diagonal, thinner, right hand side-pull/undercling crimp. Climb up into undercling shelf and up the face to horizontal rail and top out above.
On the uphill-most vertical face, this one is in the middle. Stand start center face matched on a big flat ledge. Work up to perch on ledge, then follow up above to top out.

To the left of "Dark Days" on the opposite (left) side of the close tree, stand start mid face on the long rail below bullseye hole. Grab the bullseye pocket and take it directly to the top from there.
A fun, comfortable height, slab-to-vert boulder with mostly easy to moderate lines. Good landings and an easy walk off. In between Darkside Roof and Pythagoras.
